author: Ivo Roilev
comment: When you run in the rain, or shower with your smartwatch, its screen gets random activated. This app will keep it from launching random apps and stopping your music while you run/cycle in the rain  I would love to have a "Sleep time" version of this app, with only the time. Have "Baby Time On", date and "swipe up ..." text removed. Maybe lower the brightness to minimum too. My usual watch faces are too bright for night time. And when I move, they accidentally brighten up to normal mode, flooding the bedroom with light and waking me up.
title: Perfect for sport too

author: Barry Hemmons
comment: Great idea and I use it every day with my twins as it's much better than going without, but does have one big flaw. It doesn't stop 'swipe to open' apps - namely Mini Launcher and Bubble Launcher - not sure if this is just an impossibility of Wear, but if it could be done this would be 5*. Also is tricky to unlock sometimes, but would rather that than too easy.
title: Good start but not quite perfect

author: Autumn Harmony
comment: I can't even get it to open. It does not show up in my apps, only on my playlist and there is only the option to uninstall, not to open. How the heck do you use this thing?
title: Maybe I'm missing something?

author: Chris Severn
comment: I don't know what it is, but I have to try about 30 times to unlock it. I'm always detected as a baby.  And unfortunately it doesn't lock out the mini launcher. Improve those two and it would be fantastic.
title: Great concept

author: Ethan Matthew Hunt
comment: My baby found toast message and screen scraping with nails. Please add feature for turn on/off toast message. Thank you
title: Good, but...

author: Sam Barillaro
comment: Have to try way too many times to unlock the watch with little to no feedback as to whether you are swiping correctly or not. Running on Moto 360.
title: Adult proof

author: Ryan Helmer
comment: Wear mini launcher will still load with a swipe from the side letting my baby launch apps.
title: Doesn't work anymore :(

author: Michael Schafer
comment: This works great when handling a baby that loves to play with your watch!   Now if someone can create an app to keep the baby from pulling the phone out of my shirt pocket, I'll be all set!
title: I needed this!

author: John Becknell
comment: Works great for me, and with an Asus zenwatch and an lg g watch, it's easy to activate and disactivate.   Seems to have a slightly larger battery draw than a regular watch face, but does the job...
title: World well

author: Nicola Armstrong
comment: Stops curious toddlers and the shower from messing with my watch simply and easily.
title: Basic but functional

author: nimatala gailani
comment: I hate it because it still not qorking

author: Kyle Veatch
comment: Works fine on my Moto 360. Can say "start baby time" if the little one starts reaching for it.
title: Works as advertised

author: Steve Hassenplug
comment: My 6 month old loves to play with my watch.  I'm looking forward to giving this a try.
title: Good idea

author: Thien Phuc
comment: plz add second hand clock :(
title: plz add second hand

author: Cesar Nogueira
comment: Doesn't work

author: kb lock
comment: Finally stop turning the watch on at night
title: Great for sleep

author: Curtis Powell
comment: Liking the new format!!
title: Great update!

author: David Branson
comment: I really needed this, and it's great, but it needs a couple of improvements for five stars. First, the watch face flashes into view each time the screen goes from off to the lock screen, which is still too interesting for my three-year-old to resist. Second, it seems to want to keep the screen on most of the time, even though I have "always on" switched off. It also seems to light up on a wrist flick, even when I have the watch muted, so it should require a tap to light up. Still very good, though.
title: Just what I needed

author: Jimmy Casas
comment: The app does what it is supposed to: prevent your children from messing with your watch. However it is not perfect... yet. If the time could be changed to the 12 hour display (am/pm) instead of 24 hr time that would be great. Also, it once activated, the screen remains in ambient mode (which can KILL the Moto 360). If the screen timeout could be fixed, that would be huge! Those two fixes would equal 5 stars. Great app.
title: Needs Just Two Things To Be Perfect

author: Nick Tsiotinos
comment: I have a two, 6 and 8 year old. All are mischievous! This has saved me losing notifications and it keeps the watch from turning on all the time when I don't want it to. Excellent work!

reply.author: Yoni Samlan
reply.content: Wow - I had a hard enough time with the Wear while dealing with one not-yet-mobile kid; I can't imagine trying to chase three of them around without doing terrible things on my watch. Glad I could help!

title: PERFECT!

author: Nick Sutrich
comment: The name says it all.  Perfect for when I'm holding my 4 month old son and he tries to grab my shiny watch.  No harm done!  As a side note I also use it at night when using Sleep as Android for sleep tracking so I don't accidentally press something.  Thanks dev!!
title: Ideal

author: Edu Pereda
comment: I think the idea is awesome, but it is really difficult to unlock. It takes several attempts of swipe up twice and swipe down twice until I am able to unlock it. I also agree with some people that the app could easily be called Shower Time :)
title: Really good idea, but difficult to unlock

author: Seng Liang Ng
comment: I was looking for a Do not Disturb for my LG G watch. Accidental baby swipe, sudden light top of the screen while I am in a cinema etc. This is just what I needed.
title: Useful, just what I was looking for

author: Will Johnson
comment: This is probably the app I use the most on my G Watch. My 8 month old is immediately drawn to the watch anytime I kick him up. This starts easily with the voice command (which helps when my arms are full of flailing infant), and works perfectly.
title: Perfect app for those with small kids

author: Lloyd Kalicki
comment: Humans can relax now as inadvertent swiping by baby digits won't cause a light show anymore!
title: Great app

author: Max Lieblich
comment: My son already did a bunch of accidental swipes (and gets distracted by the watch). This is exactly what I need. Love the fact that you posted the source.
title: Perfect

author: Thomas Breitenbach
comment: After getting a smart watch, my kid goes crazy trying to touch it during diaper changes. Thank you for making my life a bit easier.
title: Thank you

author: Richard Coupe
comment: My first evening with my G watch and my one year old was naturally fascinated, so this app couldn't be more useful. Absolutely perfect!
title: Superb and timely!

author: Ryan Parker
comment: Works great when carrying around my 4 month old who is constantly hitting my watch and making the voice command pop up. Simple yet effective!
title: Serves its purpose!

author: Cory Roy
comment: I was having problems with my baby and this watch ⌚ and I guess the author was too. Thanks!

reply.author: Yoni Samlan
reply.content: Yup - I have a 3-month-old who just discovered use of his hands. For grabbing everything in reach. Glad you found this useful!

title: Great app

author: Juan B
comment: I know is not meant for that, but the water drops screw with my watch more than my preschooler. Awesome app.
title: This is awesome for while in the shower

author: Mike Worth
comment: Was finding wearing my watch around my 1 year old daughter was a bad idea and this fixes the problem! Thanks!

reply.author: Yoni Samlan
reply.content: I suspect that a hazard of Google's developer team being made up of primarily 23 year old men is that sometimes the products aren't really optimized for the parent set. Glad I could be of some help!

title: Perfect

author: David Boies
comment: My daughter just turned 1, so she is curious about everything! Thank you for a simple, yet thought out app!
title: Great!

author: Jeremy Reger
comment: Perfect for us mom's and dad's with little ones.. I got my G watch yesterday and came looking for this fix today.
title: Exactly what I needed..

author: Jon Rutlen
comment: Works great for preventing the screen from activating when washing dishes or showering!
title: Water time!

author: Obi Onyeador
comment: Too difficult to turn off

reply.author: Yoni Samlan
reply.content: Glad you like the app! What do you mean by "edit the screen"? What would you like to be able to edit?

title: Allow

author: Julius Heilman
comment: This app is a great idea, unfortunately does not lock out wear mini launcher.
title: Great idea

author: Henrik Sandström
comment: This should be renamed the shower wear app
title: Should be renamed

comment: Does exactly what it says. Easy to set and easy to disable.
title: What more can you ask for?

author: Marty Ballard
comment: This works great with wear.
title: Great lock for wear
